description:
《英文天天写》是沪江社团一档写作类社刊，其目的在于提升大家的英语写作能力。每期节目主持人都会给出一个话题，积极参加的童鞋还会得到主持人的专业点评哦！想提高英语写作的童鞋千万不要错过哦！去沪江社团订阅本社刊！

       

话题：

Writing: imagine a scenario or express your opinion
Stagnant
Stagnant means standing still and not moving. What is stagnant? Why is it stagnant? What will be the outocme?
This week's topic: It was stagnant... (90-110 words)

Suggestions:
1) stagnant economy
2) stagnant water
3) stagnant progress
4) stagnant surrounding
5) Instead of writing a scenario, feel free to comment on the story below.

范例1：

He moved the slider of the time counter to skip pass the stagnant moments. Since there were no shades or blinds covering the large windows, even if the lights were all turned off inside, the space was still dimly lit by lights from the outside. Shawn paid careful attention to the screen, then, he saw it. The hidden camera, cleverly covered by books, was place on the bookshelf on the opposite wall, facing the desk. Soon enough, a dark figure was entered his office, briefly looked around, and sat down at his desk.

想要得到专业主持人的点评和意见吗？快来节目现场一试身手吧>>

title: 英文天天写：Stagnant

description:
《英乐天天唱》是一档模仿唱歌类节目，目的在于提升大家的英语口语能力。主持人会在每期节目中选取好听的歌曲片段，并给出发音提示和模仿示例。喜欢听音乐的童鞋可要积极参与哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

《Words I Couldn't Say》原唱是Rascal Flatts，这是一个由来自哥伦布的Gary Levox、Jay DeMarcus and Joe Don Rooney三名成员组成，是一个乡村音乐风格的乐队，他们以演唱和谐而闻名。《Words I Couldn't Say》收录在他们2006年发行的专辑《Me And My Gang》中。但Leighton Meester莉顿·梅斯却是让这首歌真正风靡起来的人。Leighton Meester莉顿·梅斯因为主演《绯闻女孩》而开始走红。之后她在主演的电影《Country Strong (乡谣情缘)》中翻唱了这首歌。

Rascal Flatts - Words I Couldn't Say
In a book in a box in the closet
In a line in a song I once heard
In a moment on a front porch
Late one June
In a breath inside a whisper
Beneath the moon
There it was at the tip of my fingers
There it was on the tip of my tongue
There you were and I had never been that far
There it was the whole world
Wrapped inside my arms
And I let it all slip away --
Chorus:
What do I do now that you're gone
No back up plan, no second chance
And no one else to blame
All I can hear in the silence
That remains
Are the words I couldn't say

模唱部分：

伴奏：

There's a rain that'll
Never stop falling
There's a wall that I've tried to
Take down
What I should've said
Just wouldn't pass my lips
So I held back and now we've
Come to this
And it's too late now --
Repeat Chorus
What do I do now that you're gone
No back up plan, no second chance
And no one else to blame
All I can hear in the silence
That remains
Are the words I couldn't say
Are the words I couldn't say
I should have found a way
To tell you how I felt
Now the only one I'm tellin' is myself
Repeat Chorus
What do I do now that you're gone
No back up plan, no second chance
And no one else to blame
All I can hear in the silence
That remains
Are the words I couldn't say
What do I do, what do I say
And no one else to blame
All I can hear in the silence that
Remains
Are the words I couldn't say
END

title: 英文歌曲天天唱：Words I Couldnt Say

description:
I began by asking Peter for his reaction to the huge fines levied on the banks this week.

Well, for me the most interesting thing is that you have the Department of Justice saying that shows that we will vigorously prosecute people who do this sort of thing. Well, they don't actually vigorously prosecute. What they do is they vigorously press them into a settlement. To prosecute something, to me, means taking it to court, putting it in front of the judge and having a proper ruling based on the evidence. This is the problem with a lot of these big settlements we're seeing in the areas of foreign exchange rigging, rigging interest rates, bribery, tax evasion - all these big core cases involving banks and so on. A lot of it doesn't actually come to court. So we, the public, don't really get to hear the evidence. Some of the details are kept hidden from us. So this isn't satisfactory.

Sujeet in New York. Do you think the fact that so many banks have been forced to settle won't actually change the culture at these banks in the future?

Yeah, that's the question really the shareholders are wondering. Jamie Dimon, the CEO of JP Morgan, said the activities were the function of just a few employees. The question now is if shareholders are gonna finally rise up and demand accountability from CEOs. These fines are big. But one of views is that they're just a cost of doing business and they're just a line item and an expense.
